review: Hmmm tasty goodness.. My favorite place that always gets does a wonderful job. Best Food at great prices too, and customer service exceeds my expectations.

After a day of hiking, my hubby and I stopped in Applebee's Sequim for a drink and whatever else we decided to eat/drink.  We were seated in the bar at one of those tall tables with stools.  We sat there for about 15 minutes before a waitress came to take our order.  We ordered a couple of beers.  Mind you, aside from the bartenders 3 buddies at the bar, we were the only customers in the bar, and the restaurant wasn't busy either.  I know the people seated at the bar were the bartenders buddies because he was engrossed in deep conversation with them, and referred to them multiple times as "Bro".  After the waitress took our order we waited about another 15 minutes and nada, nothing, zip....crickets.  My husband caught the eye of the bartender a couple times but he was too busy with his "Bros".  So we walked out - and you can be sure we won't be back.

This is a good Applebee's. Chain yes...but the food is always good and the staff always friendly. Coming on the weekend? Head straight to the bar. Greg (is that his name?) is an amazing bartender, he knows everyone's names. Not sure how he does it but he remembers everyone. Great happy hour prices too!
If you're looking for an Applebee's, this one is as good as any. Most of the folks here always appear to be regulars. The staff here is friendly, and the bar service is prompt.
Met my expectations for an Applebee's.  Service was great.  Prices cheaper than other local sit down restaurants.

We have eaten here twice.  Both times it was the same.  The employees are pleasant and congenial, however the food is so bland that it has no taste whatsoever.  It is as if they have some sort of a "Taste Extractor" in the kitchen whereby they remove all vestige of taste from the food and then sell it to some other restaurant to put into their dishes.  Uncanny!

Last time we come here.  Walked in and greeter was great, went downhill after that.  Food tepid, server kept disappearing, no refill or even asked if we wanted one on our drinks.  Cold food is inexcusable.  In fact I will probably never again go to an Applebees again due to this experience.  Ok changed from 2 stars to 5 due to great customer service after contacting main office, Renee took care of problem and will be back.

After a visit at the Dungeness spit we halted at Applebee's for lunch.  The menu was very tempting and had my expectations soar high. They sure had a great food photographer.  We ordered for a Wonton , Prawn stir fry served in rice and veggies and a Chicken steak served with Prawns.  The food was so so.Nothing that deserves specificity from me in terms of how it tasted. The cutlery that was provided to me was soiled(had a few crumbs on it). The rice slightly hard and the sauce was the worst. The steak was however way better.  We paid a sum of 33$ . If you are around the area , skip foo you have Ihop and a few other restaurants that may be better.

Great experience at Applebee's tonight. Food was terrific. Had the chicken wonton tacos (crispy and awesome), boneless hot wings (moist and not at all nugget-like), steak quesadilla (cheesy and great). My wife had the tortilla soup which also got 2 thumbs up. Service was nearly perfect (empty plates could have been cleared earlier). Dale was friendly and attentive. Interior was clean and had a good vibe. Was about 75% full (arrived around 5:30). Almost didn't come because of the bad reviews. Very glad we did!

Crappy service, waited 10 minutes to get menus and then sat for over 30 minutes waiting for food in a quiet restaurant. Everyone around us was complaining about the service, also. When the food came, my hubbys fries were cold and greasy, a burger with nothing on it.  My salad was sitting in a pool of water.  The plates came out 5 minutes apart, when we finally flagged down the waitress and asked for condiments for the burger and told her about the fries, she took 10 minutes to bring the mayo and fresh fries out.  By that time the burger was cold.  We were never checked on, never asked if we needed anything and sat with empty 'ice tea' glasses.  The ice tea was so weak that it was really just water with a bit of color.  We are done with Applebees!!!

Ordered well done hamburger, was med rare. First half didn't seem to bad, so I ate that. Second half when I looked at it was super pink. Tried to take a bite and instantly lost my appetite.  Felt it was pointless at that point to say anything so we just left.  I had already  paid at the table. That night had a slight case of food poisoning.  Will never eat there for dinner again. I posted a photo of the said burger. Some like it that way, but if I did, I'd of ordered it that way. Grossed out.

We have recently moved to Sequim, Washington from Idaho, One of favorites was always Applebee's BUT we have tried the Sequim location twice. Both times it was not good and you wouldn't even recognize it as the same awesome food we got in Nampa, Idaho. On our last visit the food looked like it was just dumped on the plate. The servings were very small and didn't taste anything like the Applebee's we knew. Part of the chips were stale and our artichoke dip was over cooked. My cedar grilled lemon chicken was terrible and the riblets not much better. There is so much good local food in this area we will not be returning to Applebee's in Sequim Washington anymore.

Since my husband and I are from a very small town in southwest Washington, we are so pleased to have the option of an Applebees now that we live in Sequim.  When we walk in it always feels like a  party is in process...friendly faces, excellent service, good food.  Thank you, Applebees--another great employer in Clallam County!
Slow service, disrespectful staff, mediocre cooking, wait to table wasn't bad but don't expect any form of good customer service.

Gave Applebees a try last night.  Been there before, its always hit or miss.  Last night will my last though.  I must say, two times before food wasn't good but at least service made up for it. But last night was a total failure on their end.  We were sat, and my father watched the waitress visiting with her girlfriends one both down.  Totally ignoring her new table.  Then when she finally broke away, STILL did not approach us but went back to the kitchen for a tad. She finally came up to our table, we gave her our drink order, hot water for myself, beer on tap for my dad.  Took awhile to get the water, and possibly 15 minutes for the beer.  My dad could see the bar which was not busy at all, but the bartender was too busy chatting at the bar with someone to notice an order had been placed!  When my dad questioned the server her comment back was, "I know, I will give her the stink eye".  Five minutes later he had his beer.  Now for the dinner, I had a salad which was okay, dad had a 6oz steak which was cooked correctly at medium BUT, it was incredibly tough!  Dad took his first bite, and chewed, chewed and could not even get through it. (And he has great teeth by the way).  He had to remove it from his mouth and place it on the plate.  Next cut and bite, same thing!  I told my dad his 6oz steak will be a 4oz at looks like.  Our  waitress finally comes up to see how things are.  I'm half done with my salad.  Dad told her the problem and she left quickly to get her manager.  Over 10 minutes later, I had to get up and find the waitress to ask where the manager was?!  She states, "oh, I told her, I will tell her again".  The manager came to our table and noticed what my dad had not been even able to chew through. 90% of the steak was tougher than leather. Of course she apologized, asked if they could fire another or offer something different, but we were done.  Dad couldn't eat it.  She offered a free dessert.  That's when I had to ask the manager myself, "you are going to comp this right?"   Oh certainly she stated.  Although I feel if we had taken a free dessert she would of been happier.  And so, as we walked out the door, I looked over my shoulder at my dad, and his words were, "goodbye Applebees, never again".  And those were EXACTLY my thoughts too.

Applebee's is comparable to TGI Friday, Chli's, and the like..right? I thought so too but this Applebee's might be the top of the line! I ordered a "7oz grilled onion sirloin with stout gravy" and it was cooked perfectly. I was really shocked! I also stole food from my other table mates. This is what happens when you don't eat your food fast enough. I will come in and swoop it from your plate because the food is that good. Everyone ordered a burger and fries. I was the only one that ordered a steak. Yum!
Pleasantly surprised by this local spot. We stayed in a hotel next door so it was the closest eatery. Good tap beer selection. Tasty food. Super friendly server. We really enjoyed our meal here.

We had a coupon, let's go to Applebee's. One thing I like about Applebee's, the menu changes and I get something new or different. Plus I read that.  A 6 oz Sirloin sounds good. Mistake. Places like this MUST know you have a coupon when the chef goes to get that chunk of meat for the grill. "He won't know this is an inferior cut. He just wants a deal". Well I know a lesser quality cut and and certain amount of fat is Ok. Nuff said. Spit most of it out on my plate. The 4 cheese a Mac and cheese and broccoli and lettuce wedge was great. So was the perfect margaritas. Wife had a Thai Shrimp Salad that was not a full portion. She had a coupon so they gave her less, in my humble opinion.  Wouldn't it be great if a place shared their best when you had a coupon, and the encouraged you to comeback again to spend more? Probably wait another 6 months before we return. But wait, the free Veterans Day meal comes in November.

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: very good. it still open during new year, when lots of restaurants closed for holidays.
This trip we ended up sitting underneath the music speaker where it was blaring crappy pop music into my ear...

Our family had the worst dining experience in recent memory. Here are a few lowlights: At 6PM they were already out of their signature steak. We were told this 15 minutes after ordering. The replacement steak was over cooked and so tough the steak knife could not cut it. The separate salmon order was poorly done and the broccoli under cooked. Overall, three of the four of us had to eat at another place, because we could not eat the Applebee's food. Good news, they did not charge us.

Wow. Just wow. Four of us stopped for dinner. We ordered our drinks. Lauren brought them to us, although she was not our server and was assigned a section across the restaurant from us. She proceeded to attack me verbally, using profanity and calling me vulgar names. I was speechless...I know her slightly and had no idea she had a problem with me. I certainly did not expect to be attacked by a Applebee's employee while dining in their restaurant. My companions were shocked. They began to call for the manager loudly. An Assistant Manager came, I was embarrassed and upset so he paid for our drinks and we left without eating. I called the Restaurant Manager the next day and discussed the situation with her. I was called back by the Regional Manager that afternoon. She assured me that it would never happen again, that everyone was very sorry and that what had occurred was absolutely not acceptabe behavior for an Applebee's employee. I was told Lauren would be severely punished...and led to believe that she would be let go. I was asked to return as a customer by the Regional Manager, who stated that my business was important to Applebees. I did return about a month later with the same friends, we ordered our drinks before our meal...and again Lauren delivered them to us! It was obvious she brought our drinks to intimidate me, she was curt and rude. We were all shocked and uncomfortable to see her at our table after our last experience. We again left without eating, determined to avoid another scene. Applebees has lost four customers over this fiasco. Whoever made the call to retain an employee like Lauren, who literally attacked a customer verbally without any provocation has lost our business for good. Lauren used her position as a Applebee's server to intimidate and embarrass a customer who she has a personal issue with, and Applebees has endorsed her unacceptable and unprofessional behavior by allowing her to do it. Wow, just wow.

Amazing service but food was mediocre at best.  Mom had to have a new plate of chicken made, the first was overcooked and dry. The manager came out shortly after receiving the second plate to ensure it was done right this time. He said he personally cooked it. My burger was dry and bland, not at all enjoyable but decided to choke it down since I knew it was typical for this chain. The Perfect Margy is a great deal at about $8, don't be afraid to order it. Again I have to say the service here is exceptional. Our waitress Shelly was very friendly, very attentive, and all in all a awesome person. Unfortunately the food is the reason I rarely ever come here, good service isn't enough to justify spending my hard earned $.

Traveling through the town on our way to Victoria we looked for a nice place to eat before getting on the ferry. Not many choices in a rural area, so because we have eaten in plenty of Applebee's, we thought why not. I'm not sure what other choices we had or even if we could of found something better. Even in a chain like Applebee's from one to the next the people working there makes all the difference.   Our seating & server were fine. My biggest problem was the food. I don't even know what exactly is was. No flavor to begin with, but the aftertaste an hour or so leaving the restaurant makes me never want to visit another Applebee's.

The staff here was extremely friendly and efficient. The food is typical chain food, over salted,  too much MSG & greasy. I suppose if I eat here once every 20 years it won't kill me. They have sports on many different TVs. Was nice to watch the basketball playoffs while I had a cocktail.

We were driving thru Sequim & wanted a good meal. We didn't want to take a chance at some of the others with higher ratings, because we always had good luck at Applebees in the past.  We were not disappointed as we got a good meal at a decent price & the service was excellent. It is located just off the freeway close to Walmart & Costco.
Have always enjoyed Applebee's! Service was great. Food outstanding and their new smoker for salmon & steaks is terrific. Liked the hot shrimp salad!

I had to eat here for lunch with coworkers while on a trip to peninsula.  I usually avoid chain restaurants but it was lunchtime, we were limited on time, and needed something quick.  We all got versions of soup and either salad or sandwich.  I got the fiesta salad and tomato basil soup - both were surprisingly good.   Service was fine.  The manager did come by to check on us - something I always appreciate.   So as much as I hate chain restaurants, I enjoyed my meal here at Applebee's.

Horrible service on a to-go order tonight.  Tried to order on-line, got all the way through and the system told me I had to call. I called and placed the order. When I got there, I waited over a half-hour for my food (it seems they forgot about me waiting.) When it finally came, the order charged me $6.59 for a caesar salad that had shown as $4 on-line. After several back and forths where the server went back to talk to the manager, they said I had gotten a large which was $6.59 (I had not been asked what size I wanted) but they'd only charge me for a small ($5.50.) The manager apparently would not budge over $1.50. I paid it, but will likely be avoiding this place with the group I'm with this weekend. I certainly will not trust them.

I try most Applebee's - I like the choice here over fast food So, chain store - yep Food - prepared as I would expect, correctly, pre measured portions . . . but good Service : makes or breaks any chain store . . . this one does very well and when I am in the area it is a . . . let's go eat at Applebee's

Tried the pretzel sticks with beer cheese dipping sauce.....which turned out to be nothing short of spectacular. I had no intention of having a beverage but our server felisha talked me into a new long island flavor and i ended up having 2. Absolutely superb service.
Good food, fast service.  Nice place to grab a bite.

The only reason I came here was to meet a friend who was passing through town and didn't know the area needed something easy to find.  I was suspicious that the food was overhyped based on the people who seem to like it.  Sure enough  my experience was just what I expected. Service was great and the environment was nice but he food was skimpy and way over seasoned! did someone say MSG?

We went out for dinner at Sequim's Applebee's.  We both ordered 9 oz parma steak and shrimp with baked potato. It was one of the worst meals we have ever had. My steak was not cut properly, full of gristle and raw. Sent it back. The waiter took my plate and brought it back minus the steak. A few minutes later brought my steak back, this time it was over cooked. We were never were offered a refill on our lemonades. When we were done another waitress asked if she could take our plates. She showed us how to pay at t he table. We asked for a receipt. Our original waiter, Cody B brought us the receipt and said he had been busy helping the bartender stock the bar. Bad service and bad food, we should not have been charged at all.   The end!!!!!!!!!!

Familiar name and good food in a town (or across many towns) where there are few chain restaurants to be found. After a long day of hiking, a nice 2 for $24 meal with appetizer and two grilled dinners  was perfect. The hostess sat us in the bar and our server was serving the entire bar and all tables, seemed a little short staffed but he did a great job.

It's an Applebee's - really, what more is there to say?   The servers are always friendly, the food is generally correct and prompt.  Drinks are always well-made.  There's nothing bad to say, but there's nothing wow-ing about it either.  If you don't have anything better to eat and don't feel like making dinner, it'll tie you over :)
Great service. Great drinks. Most of the food tastes quite bland. I usually only go for drinks and maybe an appetizer.

As far as Applebee's goes it's a good one. They service is good and the food is typical Applebee's. The only thing that kinda freaked me out was an older women came in with her friend and her DOG. They sat right next to us. Now I love dogs but in a restaurant while I'm eating. Kinda gross. The staff seemed to know her and her dog so I assumed it was a regular thing to have her dog in the booth with her.

Given the cheap prices, this was pretty decent. All our normal haunts were closed on Monday so we came here. Not bad at all. Reasonable portion sizes, some of the places we go to have gigantic portions (you also pay for it) so this is a nice change.

It's Applebee's. need I say more? Obviously you're better off cooking at home, but if you want to catch up with old friends or just socialize and get out of the house, this is a good place after 9pm for happy hour. Food is frozen not fresh and most likely microwaved.. No surprises here. But once you've had a few cocktails or beers you don't really worry about that kind of stuff. Bad food, ok service, good atmosphere.

Came for a family dinner with 7 people (two 4 year olds and 2 teens).  Everything was perfect! Our service was fast and our server Drew W. was great.  Drew was there when we needed him and not when we didn't.  He put up with all our requests and not a single part of our order was wrong!  Always had a smile and was super nice! Among the orders were the chicken alfredo which was "amazingly awesome".  The shrimp alredo was also good with plenty of shrimp and a large portion size. The kids meals were also sized well with just enough for little bellies.  The drinks were a bit slow to come from the bar but we had a few ordered and considering how busy it was there are no complaints! The house salads were huge! Plus it wasn't just lettuce and dressing; lots of tomatos, cucumber, cheese, bacon bits and croutons.  Very much worth the 4 bucks or so to add it to an entree. Overall I was impressed with how clean it was, the food and the overall experiance.  The next time I am visiting the area we will for sure keep this as one of our dining options! Thanks again to Drew for putting up with all our crazy requests and demands!

Applebees all tend to be the same food and drink experience, in my opinion, but what set this location apart was the friendly staff. We sat at the bar for lunch and the bartender was helpful and social.

I'd like to start  off by stating that I like Applebee's. I've ate there from here to Florida. I'd like to ask a question....Have you ever had a meal sizzling in front you, with aroma causing you to salivate and...you can't eat it? Does this sound weird? This truly happened, we are mature interracial couple (not that we think this plays into it). The appie was great, we had the dip. Then the main entree arrived...sizzling. However, we had no silverware. We waited politely to get someones attention then, I thought I caught the delegators eye, I was wrong. he walked by us, finally catching his attention, he tells us no problem...fine. He delegates, only to watch delegate wipe tables and delegator sits at table chatting with friends right beside us. We manage to distract him again and he states that it's on it's way. As i watch the delegate dilingently wiping tables. The delegator  appproaches the deligate and we watched a sad scene that was no more than 15' - 20' from us, resulting in still no silverware after 10 mins  of waiting and the sizzle was gone...we walked .

whatever you do don't get the waitress that has red hair who is probably in her mid 40s. worst waitress I have ever had in my entire life. every time I have gone there I almost get her every time and there is always a problem with my meal or order. one time I was on medication and had to go eat there with my mom and it was the first time I had taken the meds , I was really hungry but the medication made some foods sensitive to my stomach more than usual. I took one bite and puked and they made us pay for both meals even tho I sent it back immediately and they offered me another meal! there is however a awesome waitress. I think her name is Jamie. shes tall funny with black hair and has a few kids. shes the best waitress I have ever had. so its really a 50/50 shot. there new lunch menu is amazing!

I visited Sequim to attend a birthday celebration and afterwards went to this restaurant for burgers and beer with a friend of mine. We got there around 0:00, the place closes at 1:00am. The restaurant was empty and after a 10-min wait the bartender came by apologizing for the delay since he was talking to his manager on the back of the restaurant... He made sure to let us know how annoyed he was of taking our orders ("I don't know whose burger is this..."). Very unprofessional and rude. The food was below the Applebee's average quality. I wonder if the employees of this restaurant are comfortable dealing with a small town competition  and think they can treat customers with this total disrespect.  Anyhow, my friends that live in Sequim won't go there anymore and neither do I.

We really enjoyed our time. We have traveled this country and in all off our travels we have never had such a more wonderful waitress as we did today. Her name is Rachel and she not only has a wonderful attitude and personality but she is equally the type of professional every restaurant should have. Thank you Rachel for everything and making our dinning experience a wonderful one.
